reviews.text: The GM, Peter Austin was wonderful. We had 3 rooms on the concierge level for the weekend. The front desk staff were very helpful, the hotel looked great. My boys enjoyed the pool on Sunday morning. We had the breakfast buffet on Saturday and Sunday and it was very good. We will definately be back!
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.text: I can't relate to the negative reviews posted here, this is one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at, (and I have traveled extensively) I would even think it should be a 4*. We booked 5 rooms (traveling w/ teenagers from our church) at $55/night on Priceline. Staff was courteous, hotel was clean and beautiful, beds comfortable, bathrooms nice. We parked on the street at a meter and simply came down when it was time to fund the meter in the morning. It was truly a great hotel experience
reviews.title: A great experience!
This has a long way to go to meet Marriott Standards
reviews.text: I like to be fair so I will write the good along with the bad. I arrived early and there were no rooms available. The front desk agent told me to check back at noon but offered to store my luggage. I asked if he knew where an outlet was that I could plug in my cell phone to charge it so I could make a phone call. He told me he had no idea and that he only knew where the outlets were behind the counter. I then searched around and found one not too far from the desk. I then asked if he could give me directions to Fort Jackson. He gave me a generic map of Downtown and told me to follow Taylor street out till I reached Ft Jackson. Since Ft Jackson was not on the map, I asked about how long it took from the hotel. He replied "not too long". I was asking for a ball park here - maybe in minutes or miles. No such luck. I think he just did not know the answers but made no attempt to find out and didn't seem to care that he did not know.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in need of some upgrades. The doors to the garage were broken and never fixed that weekend. There were overflowing trash cans outside of the elevators. No one seemed to empty them. It was missing all the details of most Marriotts that I have stayed at.
reviews.title: Customer service was bad.

reviews.text: Rooms were fine. Did not eat at the hotel (and did not appear that many others did either). Pool was lousy looking. A rooftop small pool - indoors. Like what you might see at a Holiday Inn. The garage parking was free on the weekends which was a plus. Otherwise $10 a day.
reviews.title: Disappointing for a Marriott

reviews.text: I agree with other reviewers that this is pretty much a standard Marriott, but Marriott sets a pretty high standard. I've stayed here several times for business and always found my room clean, the staff pleasant, and the breakfast buffet quite good.
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel and staff

reviews.text: My husband and I along with our 3 children had a wonderful stay at the Marriott. The staff was very polite and the hotel was very clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay there again if we are in Columbia again.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: We checked in at 1130pm after a long trip and they had our resivation Name mixed up, how I do not know as it was done on line.Our room was very smelly (like mold smell). The beds looked like they had dirty sheets and the most uncomfortable small beds to sleep on. On other room were available.We all woke up and had the worst night ever in a Marriot.
reviews.title: Very Poor standard for a Marriott

reviews.text: I paid $169/night for a standard room and I was there for a business conference. While my stay wasn't horrible, it definitely was not worth the price!
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.text: Pros: Comfortable bed, nice indoor pool, good exercise equipment
reviews.title: Very average with some touches of Southern Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night on a weekend in this business hotel. It was as expected, clean, comfortable and empty. No highs or lows..a good value.
reviews.title: Fine experience At the Columbia Marriott

reviews.text: We attended the Monday practice round at the 2008 Masters and chose this hotel based on reviews, price, and close proximity to Augusta Ga.
reviews.title: Great stay in Columbia
Great creature comforts, but with infrastructure problems
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Marriott. The room was a bit small for three, however, it was very comfortable and clean. We took advantage of the pool and breakfast; which was very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most notable was the attitude of the hotel staff, everyone was extremely helpful, pleasant and kind. Requests and questions were politely addressed.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Hotel....

reviews.text: This hotel also offers a shuttle to the airport and sights downtown. It is conveniently located to restaurants, university, and the zoo.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel but a few problems

likes.disliked: — Broken shower tap and was not asked how my stay was when checking out

reviews.title: cool place
reviews.text: Wonderful charm. Baptist hospital offers a great discount to families.

Here one night for business. Rooms are a little dated, as is the facility. But quiet and fairly clean. The bathroom was more like a Courtyard or lower priced Marriott brand - not as nice as I expected. Ate in the Sports Bar - that was actually better than expected. The staff were excellent - which is usually my experience when staying in Marriotts - no free internet in room. I wasnt really wowed here.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: I admittedly had some reservation about staying here after reading some of the reviews on here, but booked anyway due to the outstanding deal I received. I have nothing but good things to say about it! From the prompt valet attendants, to the friendly front desk staff, to the courteous housekeepers.....a very positive experience. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but everything was up-to-date, clean, comfortable, etc. Overall, I would definitely consider a return visit. I paid $100/nt, with full breakfast for 2 included (apparently a weekend special). I booked through the Marriott website.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an overrated hotel, badly in need of an overhaul. The room charge was excessive for what you received. Not up to what I would expect at a Marriott. Rooms were old and worn, AC made noises all night, conceierge lounge was a joke, although the person working there in the evening was very helpful.
reviews.title: Unimpressive Place

reviews.text: My recommendation: stay at a newer or more updated property.
reviews.title: Great beds, bad service
